SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Lightning Components for B2B Commerce for Visualforce: Create Storefront Entry Points with Experience Builder

Add commerce capabilities to your Experience Builder site with Lightning components for B2B Commerce for Visualforce. These components show data from a B2B Commerce for Visualforce storefront directly on your Experience Builder site. The components also link to pages on your Visualforce storefront, which helps provide a smooth user experience between your storefront and your Experience Builder site.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: This change provides a way to use both an Experience Builder site and a Visualforce storefront together in the same B2B Commerce implementation. However, there are some important caveats:

The components are available only in Experience Builder.
The components support effective accounts only in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later. In previous versions of the managed package, the components don't support effective accounts.
The components provide isolated snippets of your storefront data on an Experience Builder site. You can't build an entire storefront using the components. Your storefront is still powered by Visualforce.
The components are supported on every Experience Builder template. However, your organization’s contract agreements can restrict which templates you're allowed to use. The Build Your Own template has no contract restrictions, and the components are compatible with any theme you select for the Build Your Own template.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, the following Lightning components are available in Experience Builder under the Custom Components section of the Components panel:

B2B Commerce Featured Products Lightning Component
B2B Commerce Header Lightning Component
B2B Commerce Reorder Lightning Component
B2B Commerce Spotlight Product Lightning Component

If you have an existing storefront built on Salesforce Tabs + Visualforce, you can start using these components by switching to an Experience Builder template.
